docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This School Management System is a comprehensive platform designed to manage the operations of school of the school, which includes student enrolment, teacher assignments, fee payments, and more. This documentation provides the users with detailed instructions on how to navigate and use the system efficiently.

docs.title: Hardware:
docs.text:
• A computer with at least 4GB of RAM
  • Minimum of 2GB free storage
  • A display with at least 1024x768 resolution

docs.title: Software:
docs.text:
• Operating System: Windows 7 or higher, Linux, or macOS
  • Python 3.8 or later
  • MySQL Server
  • Tkinter library for GUI
  • FPDF library for generating PDF reports

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text:
1. Download the Source Code Download the provided source code for the School Management System.

  2. Install Python Ensure that Python 3.8+ is installed on your system.

  3. Set Up MySQL

  4. Install MySQL Server.
  5. Create a database named schoolmanagementsystem.

  6. Set up tables by executing the provided SQL scripts.

  7. Install Dependencies

  8. Open a terminal or command prompt.

  9. Install the required libraries by running commands like: bash pip install mysql-connector-python pip install fpdf

  10. Run the Application

  11. In your terminal, navigate to the project folder.
  12. Execute the command: bash python main.py

docs.title: User Roles
docs.text: The system has several distinct user roles, each with specific functions.

docs.title: Administrator
docs.text:
• Full login access to the system
  • Enrol students and manage student data
  • Manage teachers' data
  • Manage fees and payments

docs.title: The Enrollment Page allows administrators to add and manage student details, including:
docs.text:
• Name
  • Class
  • Date of birth
  • Parent information

docs.title: The Account Management section facilitates the management of fees and payments for students. Users can:
docs.text:
• Add new payments
  • Update existing records
  • Generate reports

docs.title: The Teacher Page is a dedicated section for managing teacher data. Administrators can use this page to:
docs.text:
• Manage teacher information, such as their assigned class
  • Update contact information
  • Enter and view salary details

docs.title: Login Page
docs.text:
• Upon launching the system, users are required to log in using their credentials.
  • Enter the username and password, then click the Login button

docs.title: Main Menu
docs.text:
• Once logged in, the main menu provides access to different modules such as Enrollment, Account, and Teacher.
  • Select a module by clicking on the respective button.

docs.title: Adding New Students
docs.text:
• Navigate to the Enrollment Page.
  • Fill in the student's details, including:
  • Name
  • Class
  • Date of birth
  • Parent information
  • Click Add New to save the student's information.

docs.title: Adding Teachers
docs.text:
• Go to the Teacher Page.
  • Enter the teacher's information, such as:
  • Name
  • Assigned class
  • Contact details
  • Click Save to add the teacher to the database.

docs.title: Managing Fees
docs.text:
• On the Account Page, enter payment details for students, including:
  • Amount paid
  • Balance
  • Payment date

docs.title: Reporting and Data Export
docs.text: The system allows users to generate PDF reports for fees and other data. On the Account Page, there is an option to generate and download fee records as PDF files.

docs.title: To generate a report:
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Account Page.
  2. Click the Generate PDF button after selecting the relevant data.
  3. The PDF will be saved to your system for review.

docs.title: Database Connection Errors
docs.text: • Ensure that MySQL is running on your local system and that the correct credentials are provided in the system settings.

docs.title: Login Issues
docs.text: • Verify your username and password. If issues persist, contact the administrator for password reset.

docs.title: Data Entry Errors
docs.text: • Make sure that all required fields are filled before submitting a form.
